column1: How easy are HPC systems to use for you?
column2: How easy is it to prepare/and execute applications on the HPC systems?
column3: Are you satisfied with the experience (ease of use, your productivity, ...) when using HPC systems?
column4: How useful is the (documentation) material provided by your data center(s) to use the HPC systems?
column5: How useful are the training courses provided by the HPC community (and your data center) to use the HPC system?
column6: Do you agree to the following statements [I have done sufficient training to do my job]
column7: Do you agree to the following statements [I miss important information what the (HPC) system is doing under the hood]
column8: Do you agree to the following statements [I miss training opportunities for important HPC topics ]
column9: Do you agree to the following statements [I have no time to do proper training]
column10: Do you agree to the following statements [My training is not recognized by professionals]
column11: Do you agree to the following statements [My productivity is low due to lack of knowledge]
column12: Do you agree to the following statements [I do understand the system sufficiently well]
column13: Do you agree to the following statements [It is difficult to identify which training courses are relevant to me]
column14: Do you agree to the following statements [I cannot find out the schedules of trainings]
column15: Do you agree to the following statements [I would be interested to obtain a recognized certificate for my competences]
column16: Do you agree to the following statements [I did not attend some training due to registration difficulties]
column17: Do you agree to the following statements [I did not attend some training due to costs (that I couldn't pay for)]
column18: Do you agree to the following statements [I need more training to fulfill my role productively]
column19: Do you agree to the following statements [I prefer virtual training over onsite events]
column20: How many training events have you attended over the last 5 years. (Hands-on in lectures count individually)
